Class ServerFileSystemManager

  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object
implements StatePersistable

      • addDirectoryChild

        public ServerFsAddChildResult addDirectoryChild(FsDirectory parent,
                                                FileSystemObject child)
                                         throws NotEnoughSpaceLeftException
        Add a child to directory.
        Parameters:
        parent - parent directory
        child - child object
        Returns:
        add result
        Throws:
        NotEnoughSpaceLeftException - thrown when parent directory is mounted and child would inherit it's mount device, but wouldnt fit

        public ServerStorage getFsObjectMountEntry(FileSystemObject object)
        Get mount device of object.
        Parameters:
        object - object
        Returns:
        mount device or null

      • getFsObjectMountDevice

        public ServerStorage getFsObjectMountDevice(FileSystemObject object)
        Returns either direct or indirect mount device of passed FsObject object. It looks for a direct entry for given object first and if it doesnt find one attempts to get one from hierarchy up its parent tree.
        Parameters:
        object - object we want to know the mount storage of
        Returns:
        either storage or null

      • getFsObjectMountDeviceByName

        public ServerStorage getFsObjectMountDeviceByName(FileSystemObject object)
        Returns either direct or indirect mount device of passed FsObject object. It looks for a direct entry for given object first and if it doesnt find one attempts to get one from hierarchy up its parent tree.
        Parameters:
        object - object we want to know the mount storage of
        Returns:
        either storage or null

      • getMountableHierarchy

        public java.util.List<FileSystemObject> getMountableHierarchy(FsDirectory root)
        Returns a list of FsObjects that will be mounted as well by mounting their root folder.
        Parameters:
        root - root folder
        Returns:
        list of FsObjects to be affected by the mount

      • getObjectListSize

        public ByteSize getObjectListSize(java.util.List<FileSystemObject> objects)
        Returns the ByteSize representation of size of passed FsObject objects. Does not account for children of those objects.
        Parameters:
        objects - list of objects
        Returns:
        size of objects

        public void forceMount(ServerStorage storage,
                       FileSystemObject object)
        Forcefully mount object onto storage. If necessary, storage will be resized to fit object.
        Parameters:
        storage - stroage
